page.title: 11Local history. Leighton Hall
page.content: {An interesting visitor.} Today we interviewed Miss Puleston Jones. She taught at our school over 50 years ago, and although she went away for a long time, she still remembers a lot about Leighton village in those days. She told us that members of the Naylor family of Leighton Hall would come and visit the school and inspect the work. Often, pupils were invited to the Hall on special occasions. At Christmas everyone sang carols, and then were given an orange each and a mince-pie as big as a saucer to take home. Miss Puleston Jones said that the Naylor family had many people from the village working for them as maids, butlers, gardeners, foresters, farmers, chauffeurs, cooks, stonemasons and other occupations.
